title: Gogglebox viewers in tears as father dies hours after meeting daughter
text:
Gogglebox viewers in tears at Stand Up To Cancer episode (Picture: Channel 4)

It was an emotional night on Gogglebox as the Channel 4 hit raised awareness for the Stand Up To Cancer campaign.

Viewers and A-listers alike were left in tears as they watched a series of heartbreaking stories from families who have lost their loved ones.

One in particular broke the hearts of a number of fans, who took to Twitter sobbing over the story.

Explaining how her husband, Brett, had battled a brain tumour, mother-of-three Nicola appeared on the screen to retell her tale.

‘We sat down with his neurologist and they went through the extremes of what the surgery could lead to,’ she said into the camera.

The grieving wife went onto confess how doctors had told the family that they could remove the tumour, or the operation could result in death.

The episode shared a heartbreaking story of a dad who died from cancer (Picture: Channel 4)

There wasn’t a dry eye in the house (Picture: Channel 4)

She continued: ‘We almost started to panic and they took as much of the tumour away as they could.

‘When the tumour grew back it was more aggressive it couldn’t be operated on.’

Nicola then revealed that she fell pregnant again with another daughter, who they named Arya.

However, when she went into labour in Luton, her hubby suffered from a seizure in Milton Keynes.

After giving birth, she rushed up the M1 to be by Brett’s side, and took her newborn baby with her.

‘When we arrived there,’ Nicola said: ‘I took her over to him and laid her on him and described what she looked like. So we had a couple of hours.’

Arya was born at 5.07am while her father passed away at 8.25am (Picture: Channel 4)

She went on: ‘I said to him it’s okay, like don’t hurt yourself any more.’

Arya was born at 5.07am while her father passed away at 8.25am.

After the tragic story, viewers flooded social media with all the heartbreaking posts.

‘If you paused #Gogglebox and are catching up, get the tissues out #SU2C,’ one warned while another added: ‘Omg! #gogglebox has got me in bits.’

Someone else said: ‘#Gogglebox was a rollercoaster this week. There can’t be many shows that’ll make you laugh out loud and cry real tears within one hour. #StandUpToCancer.’

Gogglebox continues next Friday at 9pm on Channel 4.
